source_sentence: Ajjhattaṁ samudayadhammānupassī vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharanto vedanaṁ nābhinandati nābhivadati na ajjhoseti, abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṁ gameti;
translation: They don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to feeling ...
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally ...
They meditate observing feelings internally ...

source_sentence: bahiddhā samudayadhammānupassī vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharanto vedanaṁ nābhinandati nābhivadati na ajjhoseti, abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṁ gameti;
translation: principles externally ...
externally ...
feelings externally ...
feelings internally and externally ...
feelings internally and externally ...

source_sentence: ajjhattabahiddhā samudayavayadhammānupassī vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharanto vedanaṁ nābhinandati nābhivadati na ajjhoseti, abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṁ gameti.
translation: They don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to feeling.

source_sentence: Imehi dvādasahi ākārehi vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharanto …pe…
translation: Living contemplating (the nature of) feelings in these twelve ways ...
It’s not possible to depart,

source_sentence: Atha vā vedanaṁ aniccato passanto vedanaṁ nābhinandati nābhivadati na ajjhoseti, abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṁ gameti.
translation: Or they don’t approve, welcome, or keep clinging to feeling ...

source_sentence: Vedanaṁ dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato …pe…
translation: When a dart person has come back from pain, he’s a dart, misery, suffering, and obsess.

source_sentence: nissaraṇato passanto vedanaṁ nābhinandati nābhivadati na ajjhoseti, abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṁ gameti.
translation: Seeing an escape from feeling ...

source_sentence: Imehi cattālīsāya ākārehi vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharanto vedanaṁ nābhinandati nābhivadati na ajjhoseti, abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṁ gametīti—
translation: When they meditate observing an aspect of feelings, they don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to feeling ...
inside and outside -

source_sentence: **Evaṁ satassa carato**ti evaṁ satassa sampajānassa carato viharato iriyato vattayato pālayato yapayato yāpayatoti—
translation: Spearly in this way, when he lives mindfully, he proceeds inspires,
That’s how to live mindfully

source_sentence: **Viññāṇaṁ uparujjhatī**ti puññābhisaṅkhārasahagataṁ viññāṇaṁ apuññābhisaṅkhārasahagataṁ viññāṇaṁ āneñjābhisaṅkhārasahagataṁ viññāṇaṁ nirujjhati vūpasammati atthaṁ gacchati paṭippassambhatīti—
translation: consciousness ceases and then that consciousness ceases.
consciousness cease.
The Buddha replied,
“Dears and externally
I don’t approve of feeling ...
That’s how to live mindfully
consciousness ceases.”
spoke with verses ...
you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple.
